Faction.name: {=ghilmanClanName}Kolemen
Faction.text: {=4TiYXBqK}The Kolemen are a band of mercenaries who recruit from the Darshi tribes of the lands to the east of Calradia. In an obscure eastern tradition, they are legally their own slaves and masters: each “sells“ himself to the order and, in the process, becomes a part-owner. They are known for their fine horses and fine clothes. But no one should assume from their oiled locks, perfumes and peacock feathers that they spend more time preening then training. Their skills as mounted archers are second to none, and as lancers are close behind the Vlandians and Imperial cataphracts.

Faction.name: {=LqTTchsa}Lost Legion
Faction.text: {=bhxVA9w7}The Calradian Empire's famed Nineth Legion; the 'Jackals of Jalmarys', was raised in the year 636 by the emperor Ecsorios Osticos. It served with distinction for centuries, crushing all foes under foot. However, in the year 934 the nineth was sent into the Battanian highlands on a routine patrol, never to return. Rumours spread that the legion was cut down by a horde of Battanian falxmen; its officers massacred and its standards destroyed. Those few who survived took to the hills, becoming known as the Lost Legion. Whilst still bearing the arms and armor of a proud imperial legion, these men now fight for none but themselves, carving a bloody swathe across Calradia.

Faction.name: {=7k9izAvC}Skolderbroda
Faction.text: {=bsPd5zri}The Skolderbroda, or Shield Brothers, are a mercenary company for those who take fighting and training very seriously. They are primarily Nordic but do allow recruits from other cultures, as long as an already-serving Shield Brother will vouch for them. Their rules are almost monastic:no women in their encampments and no amusements, and no Brother is allowed to spend the night outside without permission. In combat they fight with spear and axe in the Nordic style, and are valued by all the noble houses of the north.

Faction.name: {=UmVjzPI4}Company of the Golden Boar
Faction.text: {=tae3lhXh}The Company are Vlandians, mostly local levies who don't adjust well to peacetime and opted for a life of constant warfare. They are probably the least disciplined and most brigandish of Calradia's mercenaries, and a scourge to any bit of countryside where they are allowed to run loose. Still, like all mercenaries, they know that their future earnings depend on their reputation, so they honor their contracts and practice their skills, particularly with the crossbow, to ensure their employers receive their money's worth.

Faction.name: {=NObV048p}Beni Zilal
Faction.text: The Beni Zilal, or so-called “Keepers of the Secret,” are a shadowy order who developed around the taverns and bath-houses of the Banu Asera. Trading in secrets and lies, it is rumoured the Beni Zilal have made more than one lord of the nahasa, and have been involved in the assassination of many more. However, even the most shadowy of cabal falls in need of coin from time to time, and so a chapter of the Beni Zilal now roam the southern wastes, becoming little more than a tribe of bandits.

Faction.name: {=nh4Y3LOc}Wolfskins
Faction.text: {=7bhNgOKd}The Wolfskins are heirs to a long tradition in the Battanian lands wherein great warriors went “wilding” for part of their youth, learning the ways of the woods and how to suffer hardship. So long as a Wolfskin wears no sewn clothes, eats no cooked food, and sleeps under no roof, he is immune from the laws of men. In fact, the modern Wolfskins tend to be the sons of wealthy families taking a few years to indulge their feral side, robbing travellers and living viciously and not necessarily hewing to the old code.

Faction.name: {=as2TiAIJ}Brotherhood of the Woods
Faction.text: {=xahrUc5n}The Brotherhood of the Woods started two generations ago as a Vlandian peasant movement, hiding out in the forests, robbing from rich Calradian merchants and giving the spoils to the poor Vlandian farmers. However, it has encountered the problems that any long-running rebel movement might - the need to ensure a steady supply of food, and also ensure that none of the poor would dare earn a bag of coins by informing on them. Slowly but surely, they have started to make use of extortion, terror, and corrupt deals with the local authorities to survive, becoming little different from any other organized bandit group in Calradia.

Faction.name: {=MVHawAEp}Hidden Hand
Faction.text: {=nQOf27Rx}The Hidden Hand are a mafia who dominate the rural areas, and sometimes the towns, of the southern parts of the Empire. They thrive by making themselves useful to authorities: repressing unrest, silencing troublesome preachers, and robbing from merchants who compete with their patrons. Many of them go back and forth between a respectable life in the towns and a criminal life in countryside, spending two or three months a year as a brigand and enforcer and the rest as a ”trader” in stolen goods, knowing full well that no one will bother them.

Faction.name: {=7WL1LWdf}Lake Rats
Faction.text: {=9ZEdEWmi}The Lake Rats live in the marshes on the shores of the great northern lake, in shacks made out of the timbers of ruined ships. They live by “wrecking“ - ie, luring ships onto shoals with false lighthouses and beacons. Because they're scorned by the rest of Calradia - ”all criminals, smell like marsh gas and mud and rotten fish” - they scorn everyone else back. Although mostly Sturgian, their ranks have been swelled by fugitives, debtors, and anyone else who'd rather live by a thieves' code than by the laws of nobles.

Faction.name: {=mtZu1l2j}Seekers of Cypegos
Faction.text: {=B8c2mNKj}The Seekers of Cypegos are a shadowy cabal of lesser Calradian lords, mercenaries, revolutionaries and brigands. Bent on a single purpose, they seek to destroy the Calradian Empire and reforge it in the image of Cypegos; the semi-mythical last king of the Calradic Kingdom. It was the Seekers who led Emperor Themestios to his doom in the Itlan Portages, luring the imperial armies ever further away from their fortified border, whilst openly feeding the Gotarnians information about their movements. No longer cloaked in anonimity, the Seekers now wage an open war against all comers.

Faction.name: {=8ba4tpRU}Jawwal
Faction.text: {=RWOYui01}The Jawwal, or “Roamers,” are the main bedouin confederacy in the Nahasa desert. They wander from highland to lowland grazing grounds, declaring huge swathes of the desert their “territory” in which any caravan must offer protection money. They compose poems of their deeds and mock other clans of the Banu Asera for having given up the “freedom” of black wool tents for stone houses in the oases. The other clans consider them boastful nuisances, though grudgingly respecting them as protectors of the old Aserai ways.

Faction.name: {=6BvGhzao}Kankharit
Faction.text: {=XJbDRBfd}The Kankharit are a nomadic clan that has recently appeared in the uplands of the Devseg, raiding and trading with the Iltanlar tribes of the region. Whilst the Iltanlar tolerate their strange gutteral tongue and unusual customs, the Kankharit often find themselves expelled from Iltanlar settlements for fighting or stealing. Indeed, some who have spent time with the Kankharit believe they are in fact the vanguard of another nomadic people further to the east, giving them the name 'Khuzait'.

Faction.name: {=o7ud4X2X}Vanni Forest Tribes
Faction.text: {=0u8ipbgn}The tribes known as the Vanni practice slash-and-burn farming in the deep woods, outside the grasp of the Sturgian boyars. They burn down tracts of trees, grow crops on the virgin soil fertilized by ash for a few years until the land is exhausted, and move on. It is an inefficient use of land but a very efficient use of labor, suitable for a numerically small population in a large area. Also, because the plots are hard to measure and tax, it's a very good strategy for people who don't care to be governed.

Faction.name: {=eC6qIOzz}Eleftheroi
Faction.text: {=9qAWNBvA}The Eleftheroi, the free people, live on the steppelands at the edge of the Empire. Originally the descendants of runaway slaves and debtors, they soon became highly valued by the local imperial commanders for their knowledge of this frontier zone. Their leaders have been granted titles, their young men taken into the retinues of archons and emperors. But though they are now very loyal to the idea of the Empire, they remain quite hostile to its actual authority.

Faction.name: {=fXENjJJL}Osticos
Faction.text: The Osticos family claims descent from a cousin of Calradios the Great. This clout has rewarded them handsomely over the generations, with a vast network of clients, and their money, serving the interests of the Osticos. However, this reputation has also come with a significant sense of entitlement, and there are few in the senate who respect their grandeous claims to power and prestige. Increasingly marginalized, they now support the rebel emperor Solarios, hoping to profit from his conquests.

Faction.name: {=UW8BjPXR}Argoros
Faction.text: The Argoros are one of the most recent additions to the aristocracy of the Calradian Empire, being founded by the two brothers Neros and Leonicos, who made their fortunes as advocates in the imperial courts. Renowned as staunch supporters of the senate, law and order, their path in recent years has taken an interesting turn. Like many houses, the secession crisis has torn the Argoros apart, with many now serving the rebel general Solarios in his eastern separatist empire, fighting against the very senate they once claimed to uphold.

Faction.name: {=txCNVmSV}Neretzes
Faction.text: The Neretzes family is among the oldest and most respected in Calradia. Claiming descent from one of the original followers of Calradios the Great, one may find a member of the Neretzes in almost every imperial town, attending to matters of state, civil administration, or the legions. However, in recent years, the rebellion of Solarios has split the mighty house. Though the majority remain loyal to their patriarch, some Neretzes members may be found in both the courts of the Comnos and Dionicos houses.

Faction.name: {=tA3IRBgv}Impestores
Faction.text: The Impestores family holds a proud military tradition, serving in the Calradian Empire's wars from its earliest expansion to the present. Based primarily in the camps of the eastern legions for generations now, they naturally sided with Solarios in his eastern wars, then willingly followed him into secession from the empire. Not known for their loyalty, many senators believe the Impestores will simply follow whoever offers them a chance at winning glory in battle.

Faction.name: {=4rr3d8hY}Dolentos
Faction.text: The Dolentos are another military family drawn to the eastern frontiers of the Calradian Empire. Founded four generations ago by an imperial 'Master of Horse', they have gained acclaim as formidable leaders of the empire's auxiliary forces, carving a bloody wake through Myzean, Iltanlar and Darshi forces alike. Offered a chance to lead true legions by Solarios, they gladly joined his rebellion.

Faction.name: {=9ORFG9l4}Chonis
Faction.text: The Chonis are the house of a former quartermaster in the Calradian Empire's eastern legions. It is widely believed that they bought their way into the aristocracy with a fortune made by re-selling old equipment from the legions back to the state. Sneered at by the other families as being frauds, the Chonis naturally saw the potential profits to be had in Solarios' rebellion, as well as their chance at revenge on the other families.

Faction.name: {=CibaXzG8}Phalentes
Faction.text: The Phalentes family originally hail from the island of Perassis Major, in the middle of the Perassic Sea. Assimilated into Calradian society centuries ago, following the capture of the island in the Quyazic Wars, they have proved enthusiastic and loyal leaders in the senate and legions. Not particularly free-thinking, they content themselves with simply following the current imperial family, whoever they may be.

Faction.name: {=SCTf5cay}Vatatzes
Faction.text: The Vatatzes once held lands on the Biscan coast, making their fame and fortune from mining vast seams of silver and iron ore on their lands. Their history is one of strife and decline, first suffering near-constant raids from the Nords, and now disposessed from their lands by the Vlandians. Finding themselves at the court at Charasea, without land and nearly destitute, they join many other western families in attempting to reclaim their homeland.

Faction.name: {=nclQqoam}Serapides
Faction.text: The Serapides are renowned as the leaders of the Calradian populist movement, agitating for better land and employment rights for the poor of Calradia's vast urban cities. However, such rights have remained largely static over the centuries, whilst the Serapides have gained great power and prestige in the senate. Seeing in equal parts the threat and opportunity posed by the Vlandians and their kin, they now serve the secessionist senate in Charasea.

Faction.name: {=OVQoC9fn}Comnos
Faction.text: The Comnos family is a relative newcomer in Calradian politics, claiming their origins from wealthy merchants of the Temean Valley two centuries ago. During the campaigns of the general Sarapios in the north of Calradia, the merchants of the Comnos family gained notoriety for monopolizing the trade of amber and furs with Nord traders. Known for their cunning and aggression in climbing the ladder of Calradian society and poitics, they have held the imperial throne for a number of generations, and will do anything to maintain their reign.

Faction.name: {=tdGvElSy}Dionicos
Faction.text: The Dionicos family are deeply rooted to the west of Calradia, holding raising horses and cultivating grain in the rich lands around Baravenos. Indeed, for centuries, the title of 'Praetor of the Western Capital' was almost synonymous with the name Dionicos. However, with the coming of the Vlandians and their kin, the Dionicos now find themselves as refugees; their former lands forever lost to them. They are the greatest champion of the cause to reconquer the western provinces, and will fight to the bitter end to reclaim what they have lost.

Faction.name: {=UQHUu2bj}Leonipardes
Faction.text: The Leonipardes were one of the earliest families to cross the Zeos River and found estates east of the Temean valley. Their villas, famed for centuries for producing uncommonly fine wines, have hosted a cast of emperors, generals and senators. Few can rival the Leonipardes for their pedigree, and their sons are widely acclaimed, from the senate to the frontiers of the empire.

Faction.name: Protectores of the Hills
Faction.text: The Protectores of the Hills are a unit of frontiersmen from the western provinces of the Calradian Empire. Raised from the Empire's Palaic citizens, they are used to working with the local nobility, specializing in scouting and tracking. But as the Empire descended into civil war, the Protectores have begun asserting power in the areas in which they live, becoming a law unto themselves and taking what they want from passing Imperial caravans. They still will cooperate with Imperial nobles, but on their terms, not the Empire's.

Faction.name: Chosen of the Sky
Faction.text: The Chosen of the Sky are an elite order of warrior priests, hailing from a divergent sect of nomadic animism. Long spurned by traditional steppe society, the Chosen have spent centuries wandering the east, trading their services to local rulers and lately to the Calradian Empire. With Calradia plunged into crisis, they have seen an opportunity to enrich themselves, becoming an imposing threat to all in their warpath.

Faction.name: Biscani
Faction.text: The Biscani are one of the smaller Swadic migrator tribes, deriving their name from the Calradic word for the coastal lands they originally landed in. Centuries ago, they joined their Vlandian and Massa kin in travelling to Calradia, searching for wealth and lands to call their own. However, whilst the Vlandians and Massa formed large and powerful groups, eventually coalescing into kingdoms, the Biscani retained much of their old nomadic lifestyle, raiding and pillaging across Calradia's rich western highlands and fighting anyone who dares to stop them.

Faction.name: Lochanian Tribes
Faction.text: The Lochanians are the remnants of a tribal people which once occupied the northern extent of the Myzead hills. Pushed relentlessly into the northwards by centuries of conflict with the Calradian Empire, the Lochanians now dwell in the crags and along the shorelines of Lake Laconis. An outcast group spurned by almost all of Calradia, including their Gotarnian cousins, the Lochanians are now forced to fight to ensure the survival of their people.

Faction.name: Hawlan Rebels
Faction.text: The Hawlans are one of the innumerable nomadic peoples from the steppe lands to the far east of Calradia. Long ago, they were enslaved by the tribes of the horse-lords, and brought across the wide expanse of the steppes with their migrating overlords. Some Hawlans have increasingly found themselves pressed into service in the vast hordes of the Iltanlar, providing a core of expendable footmen badly needed by the mounted nomads. However, a group of rebellious Hawlans have recently broken free, and now fight their former masters for the freedom of their people.

Faction.name: Seax Shipfolk
Faction.text: The Seax peoples are recent arrivals in Calradia, so named for the long, sturdy knives they use to cut rope onboard their longships. Whether they be sea-raiders that have settled down and chosen to stay, or men who have fled the feuding clans of their frozen homeland, they fight with the unified ferocity expected of their brutal raiding culture.

Faction.name: Ethawians
Faction.text: The Ethawians are a primitive tribal people, originally inhabiting the verdant tropical lands to the south of the Nahasa desert. A fractuous nomadic people, they have historically engaged in a constant inter-tribal warfare, with no tribe ever holding total sway over the others; at least, not for long. In the recent past, travellers report the land of the Ethawians has seen great and terrible floods, and so they have started making increasing forays into the Nahasa, in search of new lands to settle.

Faction.name: Nahasan Exploratores
Faction.text: The Nahasan Exploratores are an elite force tasked with patrolling the vast deserts to the south of Calradia, ensuring the passivity of the bedouins and protecting imperial caravans from frequent raids by desert bandits. They are used to working in the harsh desert conditions, specializing in scouting and tracking. But as the Calradian Empire descended into civil war, they have begun asserting power in the areas in which they patrol, becoming a law unto themselves in the nascent Quyazic Empire and taking what they want from the scattered desert villages.

Faction.name: Aracathan Mountain Tribes
Faction.text: The Aracathan tribes are a hardy people, tempered by constant conflict. One of the few surviving remnants of the dryatic population from the lands south of Epicrotea, they have long been under threat of the Empire's domination. Unlike many of their cousins, who made a peace with the empire and were allowed to peacefully integrate into imperial society, the Aracathan Hillmen have chosen instead to mount and armed resistence, conducting raids from their sheltered villages in the hills.

Faction.name: Vezha Valkyries
Faction.text: The Vezha Valkyries are an outcast band of warrior-priestesses from the frigid northern lands of northern Calradia. Whilst it is not uncommon to see Sturgian and Vaegir women fighting to protect their homes and families, the Valkyries believe themselves to be imbued with the spirit of the war-goddess Vezha, taking strict vows to neither marry, nor mother children. Their views fly in the face of traditional northern society, with many viewing the Valkyries as little more than religious extremists.

Faction.name: Sisters of Salea
Faction.text: The Calradian Empire has always held gladiatorial games involving female fighters; or gladiatrices, as a curious form of entertainment. However, the Sisters of Salea are a relatively recent revolutionary movement in Calradia's history, being named for the famous champion gladiatrix Salea of Lycaron, who was brutally strangled to death by her patron after losing a match. Enraged by their colleague's murder, the gladiatrices of Lycaron siezed weapons, burned their barracks to the ground and made for the hills, turning to brigandry to survive. Now, the Sisters of Salea are a formidable fighting force, carving a bloody path through anyone in their way.

Faction.name: Alkit
Faction.text: The Alkit clan hail from Calradia's eastern steppe. Three generations ago, the emperor of the Calradian Empire hired them to retake the colony of Varnapolys from Nordic invaders. The fierce nomadic horsemen accomplished this with ease, and so were rewarded with rulership of the colony in the Empire's name. Now, they find themselves among the secessionists of the Vaegirs, and so must fight the very empire they once served.

Faction.name: {=Aft8nsgn}Zarinzadeh
Faction.text: The Zarinzadeh are the oldest and most powerful family in Makeb, claiming descent from merchants who originally set up their caravan to sell their wares on what would become the site of the city. Whilst not a martial people, they have survived for centuries through cunning and the liberal application of their wealth, buying the support of the common people, and the silence of their foes. Whilst it is unlikely any of their family shall prove formidable in combat, their political machinations make them a serious threat to any who would wish to cross the interests of Makeb.

Faction.name: {=Aft8nsgn}Tanaspour
Faction.text: Traditionally, the Tanashi have been a largely mercantile people, buying the support of mercenaries and puppet states to protect them from the outside world. However, the Tanaspour are an exception. Hailing from the border fort of Tepes Castle, which their family has defended for the past two centuries, the ... form one of the cornerstones of the Tanash city states, protecting their northern flank from incursions of nomads from the Devseg Plateau. Hardened warriors and experienced strategists, they will prove themselves a worthy foe in battle.

Faction.name: {=Aft8nsgn}Esbarafar
Faction.text: The Esbarafar hail from the Tanash city state of Chaikand, having migrated there only two generations ago from the Empire of the Padishah to seek their fortune in the spice trade. Demonstrating a particularly cut-throat approach to commerce, they have rapidly established themselves as one of the most prominent families in Chaikand, speaking on behalf of the city in councils with other representatives of other Tanashi cities. They have been a vocal proponent of Tanashi independence, wishing to throw off Calradian rule in favour of closer ties with their Darshi homeland.

Faction.name: {=Aft8nsgn}Uriksana
Faction.text: The Uriksana dwell in the mountain fortress of Usek Castle, set high on the slopes of the Akkan Hills in a key pass between the Tanash city states and the Devseg Plateau. The descendants of northern mercenaries who fought for the Tanashi in one of their many wars against the nomads of the Devseg, the Uriksana were rewarded for their service with lordship over the eastern borderlands. They follow the proud warrior tradition of their forebears and will defend their lands to the last.

Faction.name: {=Aft8nsgn}Sowdafar
Faction.text: The lands of the Tanashi have seen the rise and fall of many great families; from beggared merchants to once-reputed politicians cast into obscurity. The Sowdafar are one such family. Once the rulers of a petty shahdom around the ancient Darshi fortress city of Akkalat, the Sowdafar were caught offguard in the westward expansion of the Spahanfar Satrapy. Forced from their palace and into exile in the border fort of Akiser Castle, they now serve as the southernmost buffer of the Tanash city states, though they still await the day that they might reclaim their former homeland and the titles they once held there.
